Samadhi feels very privileged to host Daniel Brown for this month's meet up group! Daniel Brown, Ph.D. is the Director of the Center for Integrative Psychotherapy in Newton, MA as well as an Associate Clinical Professor of Psychology at the Harvard Medical School. Most of you may recognize his name from his collaboration with Ken Wilber and Jack Engler on Transformations of Consciousness, and his mention in Integral Spirituality. Daniel has studied meditation practice for 37 years, translating and practicing Patanjali's Yoga, Burmese Mindfulness, Indo-Tibetan Concentration, and Mahamudra. As a psychologist he spent 10 years conducting outcome research on beginning and advanced meditators. He will be leading a discussion/presentation on the Stages of Meditation and will be answering questions on meditation practice. Daniel is one of the leading scholars of the psychology of meditation and a master-teacher.He has taught Mahamudra retreats for the last 17 years. Recently he has written a new book on Mahamudra meditation entitled Pointing Out the Great Way and will be leading a meditation retreat at Samadhi in the spring.
This is a meet-up not to miss! We look forward to seeing you all there!
